title: Practice Exercise
description:
**Your Mission:** Create a "Shopping Cart Calculator" that handles user input and calculates totals! **Requirements:** - Ask the user for:
  • Item name (string) - Item price (comes as string, convert to float) - Quantity (comes as string, convert to int) - Tax rate percentage (comes as string, convert to float)
    • - Calculate:
  • Subtotal (price × quantity) - Tax amount (subtotal × tax rate / 100) - Final total (subtotal + tax)
    • - Display a formatted receipt showing all values - Use proper type conversions throughout **Bonus Challenge:** - Format the prices to 2 decimal places - Handle the case where quantity is a decimal (round it down)

hints.text:
**Hints:** - **String to float:** Use `float()` for prices and decimals - **String to int:** Use `int()` for whole numbers (quantity) - **Display numbers:** Just use the variable name in f-strings: `f"{price}"` - **Two decimal places:** Use `f"{price:.2f}"` - the `:.2f` means "2 decimal places"
  • **Conversion pattern:**``` user_input = input("Enter number: ") # Always a string number = float(user_input) # Convert to float # OR: number = int(user_input) # Convert to int ```
